column4: I have a problem starting a ftp server on ubuntu, anyone can help?
openftpd
Should I install Ubuntu Server edition?
On ubuntul I cant run a server. On windoes I can
can you be more specific? how are you attempting to start the ftp daemon?
are you sure about the path you just quoted?
it's not just "/etc/init.d/proftpd"?
and what happens when you attempt to start the daemon?
so the daemon starts just fine, then
can you try telnet to port 21? "telnet localhost 21", and see if anything responds?
1) does telnet to port 21 work? 2) how are you attempting to access the ftp server with firefox?
have you configured proftpd to permit incoming connections from the address of the remote machine?
have a look at the documentation that came with the program.
can you telnet to port 21 on your local machine from the remote one?
not connection refused? is that the entire error?
no, port 21, like so: "telnet <xx.xx.xx.xx> 21"
you have no firewalls running, either on the router, the local machine, or the remote machine?
you might look to see if anything has been dumped in a log file. try /var/log/auth.log and wherever your ftp daemon put its logs (almost certainly in /var/log as well)
/var/log/, and you're looking for warnings by the ftp daemon that a connection has been rejected.
at this point, i would urge you again to read the manual for proftpd, as i suspect you need to add the remote machine to an access list to permit the use of the ftp server.
yep, good luck.
